is a fairly remote mountain village in the north-west of the
district, about 7 km above the Satluj River.
There are a few direct buses to/from
city but it's more practical to take any of the frequent buses between Shimla and
on the main road (NH 22). Jeori is connected with Sarahan by frequent local buses, taking 1 hr, cost 15 Rs.

value: content=This 800 year old temple is the center of the village, and it's possible to stay in the temple guesthouse. At one point in time human sacrifices took place here, though thankfully, no longer.

There are some simple dhabas near the temple and a couple of somewhat better hotel restaurants.

value: price=300 Rs (double with ensuite bathroom), cheaper rooms also available
content=Clean rooms, stunning views, pleasant balcony overlooking the temple courtyard.
price=1200 Rs (double with ensuite bathroom), expensive rooms also available
content=Clean rooms, stunning views from rooms overlooking a valley.
